intro: Hirtella bangweolensis, commonly known as the Bangweol hirtella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy leaves, which give it its scientific name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or streamside areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
